title: Liquid city: Water, landscape and social formation in twenty-first century Mumbai
abstractText:
The project has four principal research themes:

i) An exploration of the role of water in the creation of urban landscapes in Mumbai 
 ranging from the domestic interior to extensive technological landscapes associated
 with water supply.

ii) An analysis of the factors operating through both the colonial and post-colonial era 
 that have contributed towards the development of sharply differentiated cultures of
 water consumption and the role of water in delineating class, ethnic and caste based 
 social formations within the city.

iii) The use of water as both metaphor and analytical tool to explore the multiple
 modernities that characterise contemporary Mumbai.

iv) The exploration of visual cultures of water through the production of a documentary film 
 that combines both ethnographic and iconographic analysis of everyday life in the 
 city.
